section.heading: Jurisdiction.
section.text: A petitioner may file a petition for protection under this subchapter if:

para.text: The petitioner resides, lives, works, or attends school in the District of Columbia:
The petitioner is under the legal custody of a District government agency; or
The underlying offense occurred in the District of Columbia.

annotations.annotation: D.C. Law 17-368 rewrote the section, which had read as follows: “The Family Division may dismiss a petition if the matter is not appropriate for disposition in the Family Division.”
